title: Investment by local authorities in vape recycling facilities

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
We are conducting some research on behalf of the UKVIA into:
•	Investment in vape recycling facilities and services by local authorities
•	Vape recycling awareness and education activities aimed at end users
We are particularly interested in understanding the following from your council. If the information is not available for all years listed, please provide for years you can.
In your response, please can you also confirm whether we have permission to reuse the information for reporting purposes and for educational purposes as a part of an online resource.
1.	Where do you offer vape waste disposal container/drop off points ? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Tip (Designated Collection Facility)  yes/no
-	Public places yes/no
-	Kerbside collections/household waste collections yes/no
-	Other, please specify
2.	If you have introduced vape waste disposal containers at your public waste tip, is this (Please answer each option as appropriate):
-	A dedicated vape waste container?
-	Collected within your small mixed WEEE stream ?
-	We do not offer consumers the opportunity to drop vape waste at our Designated Collection Facilities.
-
3.	How much have you invested in a dedicated vape collection service at your designated collection facilities? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Provide investment amount
-	We have not invested in any dedicated waste facility at our designated collection facilities.
4.	If you have introduced vape waste collection containers in public places, where have you located them? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	High street
-	Parks
-	Council owned buildings
-	Other, please specify
-	We have not introduced any vape waste collection containers in public places
5.	How much to date have you invested in vape waste collection containers in public places? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Provide investment amount
-	We have not invested in any  vape waste collection containers in public places
6.	If you have introduced kerbside/household recycling for vapes when was this service introduced? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Before 2020
-	2020
-	2021
-	2022
-	2023
-	We have not introduced kerbside/household recycling for vapes
7.	How much to date have you invested in kerbside/household collection solutions for vapes? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Provide investment amount
-	We have not invested in any kerbside/household collection solutions for vapes
8.	Have you got plans to invest in new vape collection solutions within the next 12 months? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Yes, please specify
-	No
9.	What vape collection solutions are you planning to invest in over the next 12 months? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
-	Dedicated vape containers at public tip
-	Vape recycling containers in public places
-	Kerbside/household collection solutions
-	Other, please specify
-	Not looking to invest in vape recycling facilities over the next 12 months
10.	What activities have you done to raise awareness amongst vapers on how to recycle their vapes? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
- information on the council website
- advertising in the media
- out of home advertising (eg billboards)
- social media promotions via the councils own social media channels
- email marketing
- stories via the mainstream media
- direct mail
- none of the above
Yours faithfully,
Jordan Millar

Dear Jordan Millar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to vape recycling
facilities which we received on 26/09/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 24/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear Jordan Millar,
Thank you for your request for information relating to vape recycling
facilities which we received on 26/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1.      Where do you offer vape waste disposal container/drop off points ?
(Please answer each option as appropriate)
-       Tip (Designated Collection Facility)  yes
-       Public places no
-       Kerbside collections/household waste collections no
-       Other, please specify
2.      If you have introduced vape waste disposal containers at your
public waste tip, is this (Please answer each option as appropriate):
-       A dedicated vape waste container? Yes
-       Collected within your small mixed WEEE stream ?
-       We do not offer consumers the opportunity to drop vape waste at
our Designated Collection Facilities.
-
3.      How much have you invested in a dedicated vape collection service
at your designated collection facilities? (Please answer each option as
appropriate)
-       Provide investment amount £0 the service is a free trial service
4.      If you have introduced vape waste collection containers in public
places, where have you located them? (Please answer each option as
appropriate)
We have not introduced any vape waste collection containers in
public places.
5.      How much to date have you invested in vape waste collection
containers in public places? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
We have not invested in any vape waste collection containers in
public places
6.      If you have introduced kerbside/household recycling for vapes when
was this service introduced? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
We have not introduced kerbside/household recycling for vapes
7.      How much to date have you invested in kerbside/household
collection solutions for vapes? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
We have not invested in any kerbside/household collection
solutions for vapes
8.      Have you got plans to invest in new vape collection solutions
within the next 12 months? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
No
9.      What vape collection solutions are you planning to invest in over
the next 12 months? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
We are not looking to invest in vape recycling facilities over
the next 12 months
10.     What activities have you done to raise awareness amongst vapers on
how to recycle their vapes? (Please answer each option as appropriate)
none of the above
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
